<div>\n  <p>At Henkel, you can be a game changer and craft your career. If you're up for challenging the status quo, join our team of pioneers and make your mark on the future with us.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Do you dare to make an impact?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>YOUR ROLE<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Assist in global sourcing and procurement of packaging materials, to provide uninterrupted supply with best cost, optimal quality, and desired lead time &amp; sustainable benefits<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assist in market surveys and bench marking exercises to explore new suppliers and technologies<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Opportunity to co-develop category strategy including implementation and delivery<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support supplier’s consolidation and compliance strategy<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>TEAM<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <p>Our Amsterdam office houses the global purchasing team. We are a diverse international team with various backgrounds. Joining this team, you will also be collaborating hand in hand with the regional team members located in Henkel regional hubs allowing the transformation of our packaging portfolio.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>This role is a great opportunity to discover the key role of purchasing with a specific focus on packaging. Henkel broad portfolio in Adhesives will allow you to interact with industrial and consumer-driven packaging, driving projects from the beginning to the end with a direct visible impact of your actions for the company, our markets, and our customers.<br> <br> <\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will be driving project linking supply resilience, cost out and sustainability while interacting with our global team and our pool of selected partners.<\u002Fp>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <div> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>YOUR SKILLS<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Studying towards a Bachelor’s\u002FMaster’s degree in Business, Economics or related studies<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working proficiency in English language<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Firm knowledge of MS-Office, advanced level in Excel and Power Point<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong organization and problem solving skills as well as a goal-oriented approach<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Team-oriented, flexible personality with analytical thinking<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to take on a high level of responsibility and put the knowledge gained during studies into practice<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Available for 6 months full-time as of March 2023<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>OUR OFFER<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>An exciting and educational full-time internship in an international FMCG business<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You’ll be part of an international intern community<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Fun and educational events organized for the international (BeNeLux) intern community, with opportunities to broaden your network<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A competitive internship allowance (1000 EUR Gross)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Continuous learning in a digital way via LinkedIn Learning and the Henkel learning hub<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. The scope of work includes 150+ plants and ~ 150k customers <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Manages the development and implementation of the global functional strategies: supply chain, global production networks, quality, safety, health and environment and sustainability (SHEQ).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Leads global change projects and transformational initiatives (technology selection and global roll-out; functional transformations including design, skills assessment, process redesign, business case definition, change management and upskilling) <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Manages and tracks progress or escalates, as needed, the global portfolio of projects <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Supports senior management with organization of global communication for workshops, strategy sessions in line with the annual strategic cycle <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Collaborates with senior management on all aspects of the organization’s operations and supply chain policies and initiatives <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Performs internal and external analysis of future scenarios to assess future business developments <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Gathers outside-in input regarding best-in-class operations and supply chain developments.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>YOUR SKILLS<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Experience in defining strategies and implementing them (consulting background is a plus)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in operations (plant\u002F factory experience, quality management) and supply chain area (logistics, supply\u002F demand planning) is a must<\u002Fli> \n   <li>At least 6 years of relevant working experience <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Master’s degree: Any educational background is ok. <div>\n  <p>At Henkel, you can be a game changer and craft your career. Unleash your entrepreneurial spirit by bringing your ideas to life within a global team. Our leading brands and technologies, along with our high-performing businesses will provide you with countless opportunities to develop your skills and explore new paths. Your career at Henkel will contribute to a more sustainable future, while you grow within our vibrant, diverse culture of trust and belonging. If you're up for challenging the status quo, join our team of pioneers and make your mark on the future with us.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Do you dare to make an impact?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>YOUR ROLE<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n  <ul>\n   <li>As Head of Global Demand Planning and S&amp;OP Process and Systems, you will join the Global Planning Center of Excellence and the Supply Chain team for Henkel Consumer Brands.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will shape the future of our Supply Chain Planning processes, system landscape, organizational setup, and ways of working.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will lead transformational projects related to Supply Chain Planning in Demand Planning, Demand Sensing, Long-Range Planning, S&amp;OP and IBP, and operationalize process harmonization and system changes globally.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will develop and sustain a community of practice for Demand Planning, as well as learning paths and material to ensure robust onboarding and continuous learning of our organization and best practice sharing.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will closely connect with operational teams in regions\u002Fcountries as well as other key stakeholders to understand requirements and translate those into system design considerations for future development (in collaboration with our Corporate and BU Digital Transformation Units).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will steer KPIs development and drive actions to towards high Planning performance with the regional and local operational teams to drive continuous improvements (e.g. maturity assessment, system adoption).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>You will develop and deliver top management presentations that lead to the right decisions, and act as a change agent in our journey towards Next Generation Planning.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>YOUR SKILLS<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Master or diploma with excellent degree of a leading university Supply Chain Management, Economics, Business, or Engineering<\u002Fli> \n   <li>10+ years of relevant professional experience in shaping Supply Chain\u002FPlanning, preferably in a leading global FMCG company. Experience in Operational Planning\u002FTeam Lead responsibility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proven track record in system and process analysis and implementation, incl. experience with APO DP and\u002For Next Generation Planning Platforms (e.g. Kinaxis, OMP or o9 Solutions).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>High business and change management acumen. Experience in Integrated Business Planning, and knowledge of commercial and financial planning.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Fluent English language skills, additional proficiency in any other major European language desirable.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent project management skills: working experiences in different countries\u002Fregions is a plus.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient knowledge of MS Office applications (particularly PowerPoint and Excel).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent stakeholder management, communication, and presentation skills.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Team player with high level of motivation.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. Wereldwijd te vinden in meer dan 80 landen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>De beste kappers gebruiken onze producten om de laatste modetrends aan hun klanten te kunnen aanbieden in kleur, styling, verzorging en omvorming.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Wat is ASK?<\u002Fp> \n  <p>ASK staat voor Academy Schwarzkopf en valt onder de afdeling Professional Partner Services, afgekort PPS.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Deze heeft 3 belangrijke pilaren binnen de organisatie: Image, Education en Support.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Image<\u002Fb> het tot leven brengen van de wereld rondom de producten door middel van shows, cursussen, presentaties, seminars en events.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Education <\u002Fb>alles met betrekking tot opleiding. we: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Voor de regio van Noord-Oost Nederland (Groningen, Friesland, Drenthe en Overijssel) zijn wij op zoek naar een ASK adviser voor 5 dagen in de week.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Na een interne opleiding ben je als ASK adviser verantwoordelijk voor de vaktechnische ondersteuning van onze klanten in die regio.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>In samenwerking met de rayon manager maak je afspraken en bezoek je de salons en voorzie je deze van de juiste trainingen en cursussen.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>In samenwerking met het Academy team geef je cursussen in de Academy in Werkendam, en werk je mee aan evenementen en shows.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>We zoeken een enthousiast, flexibel en gedreven persoon (M\u002FV) die zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband kan werken.<\u002Fp>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div> \n <div>\n  <p>Are you looking for a challenging marketing internship in the FMCG industry? Do you want to work with leading brands such as Witte Reus, Schwarzkopf, Persil and Fa? Then Henkel's Laundry &amp; Home Care department is looking for you!<\u002Fp> \n  <p>During this instructive internship you will become part of the marketing team and you will gain valuable experience in the dynamic environment of a successful international FMCG company. The results of your work are immediately visible and tangible when shopping in the supermarket. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>As an intern at Henkel you can make a real difference during the first steps to shape your career. You will have the opportunity to work alongside the Brand Manager on your own projects and you will be assigned your own responsibilities from the start. In addition, you work closely with other departments such as Trade Marketing and Sales and will be able to shape brands and categories in the Dutch market. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>What will you do during your internship?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Supporting the brand manager with the development and implementation of plans for the entire marketing mix<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Implement and track entire product launch processes<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Analyze and evaluate market and consumer data<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Building and maintaining contacts with other departments such as Trade Marketing and Sales<\u002Fli> \n   <li>POC with external partners such as design and creative agencies<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <p><b>What do we offer?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive internship allowance of €700 - €800 (depending on working hours)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Practical experience in one of the biggest multinational FMCG companies in the world<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to shape and work on well-known Dutch brands such as Witte Reus, Persil, Fleuril &amp; Silan<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working independently within a dynamic marketing team<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive guidance and mentoring from a brand manager within the team<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Numerous training modules to help you grow your career in the direction you like<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Possibility for a part-time internship &amp; hybrid working<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working in a young team in which (online) team outings are regularly organized<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monthly intern gathering where interns get to know each other, play games, and have fun!<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b>What are we looking for?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Student or recent graduate (maximum 3 months) Economics, Marketing or Business studies, both HBO and WO<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Affinity with Marketing<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Enthusiastic, driven and proactive<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Fluent in English and Dutch (knowledge of Dutch is a strong plus)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Available for 5\u002F6 months, minimum of 4 days per week, with flexible start dates<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p>Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. In this role, you are expected to make the difference while operating on a highly analytical level and with strong influencing skills to identify and develop opportunities and reach full customer and channel potential.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Manage and develop end to end commercial relationship with customers <br> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Accountability and responsibility for P&amp;L on customer that align Henkel objectives and strategies with those of the customer.<br> <\u002Fli> \n   <li>Monitoring customer performance and proactively adapt your plans accordingly.<br> <\u002Fli> \n updates, monthly reports, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p>This job is made for you if...<br> <br> <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Creating long-term relationships comes naturally to you.<br> Customs Business Process Owner program for Henkel Strategic Business Solutions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Providing global support and advice to BU’s and functions in case of new processes to be implemented as well as training and supporting Regional Process Experts and local colleagues.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop and drive the Trade Analytics strategy to facilitate the realization of the digital and innovation goals of Henkel<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support the business and key users in digital initiatives such as digital commerce, as well as user support for integration of new acquisitions and divestments,<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensuring Global Trade and Customs compliance and safeguard template processes within projects as well as in daily work.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Evaluating and implementing digital procedures for process optimization. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Monitor customs regulations, adjust procedures and advise appropriate parties of changes <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develop and maintain training programs for business partners involved in trade matters<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Represent Trade &amp; Bij Henkel kun je als stagiair het verschil maken en je eerste stappen in je carrière vormgeven. Je krijgt de kans om aan eigen projecten te werken en je krijgt al in een vroeg stadium je eigen verantwoordelijkheden toegewezen.
